book_overview.premise: Ten-year-old Lila Chen, navigating her blended family in Appalachian Kentucky, channels her inner inventor to combat climate change with 2025 bio-tech gadgets. As an ELL kid, academic jargon stumps her, but her nature passion unlocks vocabulary through root-hunting in an enchanted forest lab. From word-struggle woes to mastery moments, Lila engineers breakthroughs and shares her skills, proving that growing words can save the planet one invention at a time.

name_age_background.name: Lila Chen
name_age_background.background: Asian-American girl in a blended family in Appalachian Kentucky, working-class with a coal-miner stepdad
name_age_background.struggle: English Language Learner gaps in academic vocabulary

Resilient when pursuing what they love

protagonist_profile.growth_arc: Lila struggles with unfamiliar science words in school projects, frustrates when her inventions flop from misunderstood terms, breaks through by decoding roots in forest finds, masters vocabulary for successful prototypes, and teaches community kids via eco-workshops
